      • makeDirCarefully

        public static void makeDirCarefully(java.io.File dir)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        If the indicated directory exists, do nothing. Otherwise, attempt to create it and its parents via File.mkdirs(). Before returning, check to make sure it actually exists. Retry several times, with a small pause after each. If all of this fails, throw an IOException.

        Why? Because sometimes when OM starts up, files being written to a new folder are throwing IOErrors. This defensive method, synchronized and all, should minimize some (all?) of that.

        Parameters:
        dir - Folder to create if needed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if folder cannot be created

      • makeDirCarefully

        public static void makeDirCarefully(java.lang.String dirName)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        If the indicated directory exists, do nothing. Otherwise, attempt to create it and its parents via File.mkdirs(). Before returning, check to make sure it actually exists. Retry several times, with a small pause after each). If all of this fails, throw an IOException.

        Why? Because sometimes when OM starts up, files being written to a new folder are throwing IOErrors. This defensive method, synchronized and all, should minimize some (all?) of that.

        Parameters:
        dirName - Name of folder to create if needed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if folder cannot be created

      • writeStringToFileCarefully

        public static void writeStringToFileCarefully(java.io.File f,
                                              java.lang.String s)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Write the given string to the given file, via FileUtils.writeStringToFile(File, String). Before returning, check to make sure file actually exists. Retry several times, with a small pause after each. If all of this fails, throw the latest exception, or IOException.

        Why? Because sometimes when OM starts up, files being written to a new folder are throwing IOErrors. This defensive method, synchronized and all, should minimize some (all?) of that.

        Parameters:
        f - File to create (will be overwritten if it already exists)
        s - String to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file cannot be created then read

      • writeStringToFileCarefully

        public static void writeStringToFileCarefully(java.lang.String fileName,
                                              java.lang.String s)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Write the given string to the given file, via FileUtils.writeStringToFile(File, String). Before returning, check to make sure file actually exists. Retry several times, with a small pause after each. If all of this fails, throw the latest exception, or IOException.

        Why? Because sometimes when OM starts up, files being written to a new folder are throwing IOErrors. This defensive method, synchronized and all, should minimize some (all?) of that.

        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of file to create (will be overwritten if it already exists)
        s - String to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file cannot be created then read

      • matchPatterns

        public static boolean matchPatterns(java.lang.String input,
                                    java.lang.String inclusionPattern,
                                    java.lang.String exclusionPattern)
        Determine whether the given input string is valid given the specified inclusion and exclusion patterns. The comparisons are done as follows:
        1. If the input string is empty, return false.
        2. If there is no inclusion pattern, ensure the input string is not excluded by the exclusionPattern if it exists. Return true if it is not excluded. (If neither pattern was specified, then true will be returned.)
        3. If we have an inclusion pattern, return false if the input string does not match.
        4. If we matched the inclusion pattern and there is also an exclusion pattern, return true if the input string does not match the exclusion pattern.
        Parameters:
        input - String to match inclusion and exclusion patterns against.
        inclusionPattern - Regular expression to match for inclusion. If null or blank, include everything.
        exclusionPattern - Regular expression to match for exclusion. If null or blank, exclude nothing.
        Returns:
        If given string is non-empty, not excluded, and included if inclusionPattern was non-empty.

      • addExtension

        public static void addExtension(MigrationNode node,
                                java.lang.String fileNameAndExtension)
        Like DctmExtensionListener, this method makes use of ActivationJar along with Apache Tika to sniff out the mimetype of the file. WARNING: It should be noted at this listener is extremely expensive because it makes use of two dense parsers that cost a lot of runtime efficiency.
        Parameters:
        node -
        fileNameAndExtension -

      • convertStringToBoolean

        public static boolean convertStringToBoolean(java.lang.String boolStr)
        Return true if the given string is "on" or starts with "t", "y" or "1". Comparison is case-INsensitive and performed after trimming. Null string returns false.
        Parameters:
        boolStr -
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • convertStringToDate

        public static java.util.Date convertStringToDate(java.lang.String dateStr,
                                                 java.lang.String[] parsePatterns,
                                                 java.util.Date defaultDate,
                                                 boolean parseDateStrictly)
        Convert the given date in string format to a Date object, using DateUtils.parseDate to try each pattern in turn. If parseDate throws a ParseException, return the given default date instead.
        Parameters:
        dateStr -
        parsePatterns -
        defaultDate -
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • moveFile

        public static boolean moveFile(java.lang.String oldLocation,
                               java.lang.String newLocation,
                               MigrationNode node,
                               java.lang.String fileSeparator)
        Moves a file or folder indicated by the params oldLocation to newLocation. Uses param fileSeparator to determine folder structure.
        Parameters:
        oldLocation - the current location of the file
        newLocation - the destination of the file
        node - the migration node that is being moved
        fileSeparator - The seperator being used in the folder path

      • matchPatterns

        public static boolean matchPatterns(java.lang.String input,
                                    java.lang.String inclusionPattern,
                                    java.lang.String exclusionPattern,
                                    boolean allowBlanks)
        Determine whether the given input string is valid given the specified inclusion and exclusion patterns. The comparisons are done as follows:
        1. If the input string is empty, return false.
        2. If there is no inclusion pattern, ensure the input string is not excluded by the exclusionPattern if it exists. Return true if it is not excluded. (If neither pattern was specified, then true will be returned.)
        3. If we have an inclusion pattern, return false if the input string does not match.
        4. If we matched the inclusion pattern and there is also an exclusion pattern, return true if the input string does not match the exclusion pattern.
        Parameters:
        input - String to match inclusion and exclusion patterns against.
        inclusionPattern - Regular expression to match for inclusion. If null or blank, include everything.
        exclusionPattern - Regular expression to match for exclusion. If null or blank, exclude nothing.
        allowBlanks - Boolean indicating whether or not to allow blank input values. If false and a blank input value is entered, method will automatically return false. blank, exclude nothing.
        Returns:
        If given string is non-empty, not excluded, and included if inclusionPattern was non-empty.

      • isTruthy

        public static boolean isTruthy(java.lang.Object obj)
        Determines if a passed in object is truthy or falsey
        Parameters:
        obj - the object we are checking to see if it is truthy

                                     java.lang.Object secondObj)
        Utilizes the Object class for two passed in objects and attempts to check if they are equal to each other, appropriately handling GregorianCalendar, Date, String, Boolean, and Number subtypes
        Parameters:
        firstObj - the first object
        secondObj - the second object

      • updateListenerStatistics

        public static void updateListenerStatistics(MigrationNode node,
                                            java.lang.Object listenerClass,
                                            java.lang.String listenerType,
                                            long listenerStartTime)
        Updates/puts a map of listener times on the node to track how long each listener of the given listenerType took to execute
        Parameters:
        node - - the current MigrationNode
        listenerClass - - the listener class
        listenerType - - the type of listener - see @MigrationNode RESERVED_LISTENER constants
        listenerStartTime - - the listener's start time

      • updateListenerStatistics

        public static void updateListenerStatistics(QueueItem queueItem,
                                            java.lang.Object listenerClass,
                                            java.lang.String listenerType,
                                            long listenerStartTime)
        Updates/puts a map of listener times on the queue item to track how long each listener of the given listenerType took to execute
        Parameters:

        listenerClass - - the listener class
        listenerType - - the type of listener - see @MigrationNode RESERVED_LISTENER constants
        listenerStartTime - - the listener's start time
